items.content:

Chris Brandrick, your editor

They still have an important place, but Marcel explains here how we can now leave them behind in some scenarios, thanks to newer CSSÂ properties. This is a lot more interesting than itÂ sounds!

Marcel Moreau

How to Make the Web Accessible â€” Join Jon Kuperman for this video course on website accessibility, covering screen readers, ARIA, focus management, tooling, andÂ more.

Frontend Masters sponsor

Ahmad Shadeed

Patrick Brosset

âš¡ï¸ Quick bits:

  • Version 8.4 of Google's automated website auditing tool Lighthouse is available now in Chrome Canary. This post highlights what's new.
  • The W3C's design system is now live.
  • Replay is a new visual debugging tool from some former Firefox Dev Tools team members.
  • The Web Fonts working group has published a Public Working Draft of 'Incremental Font Transfer'. The spec outlines methods to incrementally transfer fonts, allowing clients to load only the portions of the font they actually need, thus speeding up font loads.
  • Mozilla has reverse engineered the way Microsoft sets Edge as default in Windows 10, enabling Firefox to quickly make itself the default.

ğŸ“™ Tutorials, Articles & Opinion

A Deep-Dive into VideoNG â€” If youâ€™ve ever wondered how video rendering works in Chromium this detailed article covers just that, along with its evolution over the last fewÂ years.

Dale Curtis (Google)

overscroll-behavior â€” What you need to know about this CSS property (it controls whether an element will use â€˜scroll chainingâ€™ orÂ not).

Mojtaba Seyedi

Developer Decisions For Building Flexible Components â€” A walk through of the decision process of taking a seemingly simple design for a component (often presented as a static mock-up) and deciding how best to translate it into code â€” keeping in mind the needs of both users and contentÂ authors.

Michelle Barker

Implementing Batch Editing in an Angular Data Grid the Easy Way â€” Use this tutorial to learn how to use Kendo UI for Angular to create a Data Grid that allows updates and saves inÂ bulk.

Progress Kendo UI for Angular sponsor

Orchestrating Complexity with Web Animations API â€” Thereâ€™s lots to learn in the Web Animations API, as such hereâ€™s a how-to looking at learning both timing and playback controls â€” a good foundation/startingÂ point.

Kirill Myshkin

Grainy Gradients â€” This tutorial looks at how generate colorful noise to add texture to a gradient using only a small amount of CSS and SVG. There's code demo's here and what you need to know in regards to browser support. It's a neatÂ effect.

Jimmy Chion

Modernising CSS Infrastructure in DevTools â€” A look at the history of CSS in DevTools, and the future plans for migrating to CSS ModuleÂ Scripts.

Kriti Sapra (Google)

Bundling Non-JavaScript Resources â€” Learn how to import and bundle various types of assets from JavaScript in a way that works both with browsers andÂ bundlers.

Ingvar Stepanyan (Google)

Build Internal Tools in Minutes with Retool, Where Visual Programming Meets the Power of Real Code

Retool sponsor

Firefoxâ€™s bolder Default is a Problem for Variable Fonts
Å ime Vidas

â–¶Â Â Three Fun Uses for ::before and ::after
Kevin Powell

The Story Behind TryShape, A Showcase for the CSS clip-pathÂ Property
Tapas Adhikary

How to Optimize Button Microcopy: Seven Suggestions with Examples
Maria Panagiotidi

Jobs

Walmart is Hiring Software Engineers â€” Code at scale, Fortune 1 scale. Learn more about Software Engineering opportunities atÂ Walmart.
Walmart Global Tech

Frontend Engineer (m/f/x) â€” Grow & work in our cross functional squads in an amazing environment, providing a personal educational budget and 30d ofÂ vacation.
HOMEDAY

Find Frontend Engineering Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

ğŸ”§ Code, Tools and Resources

Tailwind Mobile: Mobile UI Components Built with TailwindÂ CSS â€” Includes lots of utilities and components with a native iOS or Material Design look, currently available for React, with plans for Svelte and Vue in theÂ future.

Vladimir Kharlampidi

Pollen: A Library of CSS Variables Inspired by Tailwind â€” Features include no build process, no framework dependencies, and they can be used in external CSS, inline styles, andÂ CSS-in-JS.

Peppercorn

Starback.js: Create a Beautiful Falling Star Background â€” This is a pretty specific feature to add to a website and wonâ€™t be useful for most projects, but the demo is pretty neat and the API allows you to customize the speed and look of the fallingÂ stars.

Ahmad Saugi

flag-icons: A Collection of All Country Flags in SVG â€” Plus the CSS for Easier Integration

Panayiotis Lipiridis

items.content:
ğŸ‘‹ Hi folks. Your usual editor, Chris Brandrick, is enjoying a week off, so it's over to me, Peter Cooper (you may know me from such newsletters as JavaScript Weekly..) to fill in for a week. It's been a long time since I've taken the frontend reins, but hopefully you enjoy this issueÂ nonethelessÂ ;-)
__
Peter Cooper, your (temporary) editor

Frontend Focus

#â€‹507 â€” September 8, 2021 | Read on the web

Vector? Raster? Why Not Both! â€” Sometimes itâ€™s obvious when a vector based approach or a bitmap based approach will work best, but at other times there may be opportunity to combine the two.. such as in this example turning a 10MB outcome into a mereÂ 78KBÂ one.

Zach Leatherman

Interactive Learning Tools for Front-End Developers â€” There are lots of different ways to learn: hit the specs, follow some tutorials, or.. play some games? This post is a neat roundup of various interactive learning tools for learning things like CSS, JavaScript, SQL, React, Vim, and regular expressions that try to keep things light andÂ fun.

Louis Lazaris

Here's the Right Way to Manage and Deliver Images on the Web â€” Ever been stuck while trying to choose between image quality and user experience? Automate image optimization and deliver next-gen formats like AVIF, WEBP images based on the user's device and network. Store. Transform. Optimize with ease. TryÂ today.

ImageKit.io sponsor

htmlq: Like jq, But For HTML â€” jq is a popular and long standing command line tool for parsing and processing JSON files, and htmlq, written in Rust, gives you similar Swiss army knife-esque powers overÂ HTML.

Michael Maclean

â­ï¸ Â An Interactive Guide to Keyframe Animations â€” CSS keyframe animations are incredibly flexible and powerful but, says Josh, theyâ€™re also â€œa bit weird.â€ This is a deep-dive into how CSS keyframes work from the ground up and how to go about using them to build high quality WebÂ animations.

Josh W Comeau

âš¡ï¸ Quick bits:

  • Chrome 93 landed last week, marking the shift over to a four-week release cycle for Google's browser starting with version 94 later this month.
  • Over a million WordPress sites have been affected by Gutenberg template library and Redux framework vulnerabilities.
  • Firefox 92 has been released, though with relatively few developer facingÂ changes.

ğŸ“™ Tutorials, Articles & Opinion

Exploring the CSS Paint API: Blob Animation â€” A fun effect currently supported only on Chrome (and Edge) for getting gooey/blobby shapes going with CSS enhanced by JavaScript via the PaintÂ API.

Temani Afif

'I completely ignored the front end development scene for 6 months. It was fine.' â€” Given that we publish a weekly newsletter helping you keep up to date with the front end development scene, maybe itâ€™s tricky to share such opinions, but the author isnâ€™t wrong! Itâ€™s possible to take a break and not miss out on too much.. plus you can catch up with our issues later ;-)

Rach Smith

Why Use a Time Series Platform for Application Performance Monitoring â€” Learn how to use time series data for real-time observability into application performance, systems and networkÂ metrics.

InfluxData sponsor

Reducing Carbon Emissions on the Web â€” Whether or not youâ€™re an active environmentalist, you may be intrigued to know there are things you can do as a Web developer to improve the carbon footprint of yourÂ creations.

Berwyn Powell

Creating Accessible CSS Art â€” Art and visual effects generated in pure CSS are not inherently accessible but there are some ways to improveÂ matters.

Alvaro Montoro

The Fixed Background Attachment Hack â€” A look at a little trick/workaround if you want the body background in a fixed position where it stays put on scroll and have it work onÂ mobile.

Martuzaali Surti

An Analysis of Feed URLs â€” Thereâ€™s no real standard when it comes to feed/RSS/AtomÂ URLs, but it may be worth following the crowd.

Jim Nielsen

Jobs

Frontend Engineer (React, New York) â€” Dovetale helps Shopify merchants like KontrolFreek and Italic grow their creator community. Built in NYC and backed by UberÂ founders.
Dovetale

Walmart is Hiring Software Engineers â€” Impact millions of customers and associates while developing some of the biggestÂ technologies.
Walmart Global Tech

Find Frontend Engineering Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

ğŸ”§ Code, Tools and Resources

SKWAR: An Extremely Straight-Edged Variable Font â€” Itâ€™s â€˜very squareâ€™, monospaced, but does have variable width and weightÂ support.

Heydon Pickering

Shoelace: 'A Forward-Thinking Library of Web Components' â€” A collection of well designed every day UI components (buttons, drawers, inputs, menus, color pickers, and more) built in a framework agnostic way (though there are React wrappersÂ available).

Cory LaViska

timefind: Search a Web Site's History â€” A Node-based tool (which you can use from the terminal) for quickly flipping through the Web Archiveâ€™sÂ snapshots.

Nathan Manceaux-Panot

Shortcut Puts the Agile in Agile and the 'Can' in Kanban

Shortcut sponsor

bundle: A Quick npm Package Size Checker â€” Enter a package name, then hit the â€œrunâ€ button and this tool will give you the minified, bundled, and gzipped size of theÂ package.

Okiki Ojo

HTTP Nowhere: A Chrome Extension to Upgrade (or Stop) Non-Secure Requests

Chris Palmer

Fiddly: Create Beautiful and Simple HTML Pages From Your readme.md Files â€” GitHubÂ repo.

Sara Vieira

items.content:
Unsubscribe

Frontend Focus

#â€‹506 â€” September 1, 2021 | Read on the web

Image via: Mozilla

Why Are Hyperlinks Blue? â€” A deep dive into the history of interfaces and link designs over the years to track down the origin of the blue link we knowÂ today â€”Â lots of nostalgic interface design here.

Elise Blanchard

An Introduction to the Solid JavaScript Library â€” Solid is a reactive library for creating user interfaces without a virtual DOM, instead compiling templates down to real DOM nodes with fine-grained updates then doing as little as is necessary to reflect stateÂ updates.

Charlie Gerard

Dynamic Charts Based on Data Selection in Angular â€” Ever had users asking to be able to generate their own charts? This tutorial shows you how easy it can be with Kendo UI for Angular. All users can select data in the grid and then your app will generate a chart to visualizeÂ it.

Progress Kendo UI for Angular sponsor

You Want Enabling CSS Selectors, Not Disabling Ones â€” â€œAn enabling selector is what I call a selector that does a job without disabling the particular ruleâ€. Chris Coyier distills down the core of this ideaÂ here.

Silvestar BistroviÄ‡

What's New In DevTools for Chrome 94 â€” Including using DevTools in your preferred language, new CSS container queries badge, a checkbox to invert network filters, andÂ more.

Jecelyn Yeen (Google)

âš¡ï¸ Quick bits:

  • Apple has proposed adding a <model> element to HTML to display 3D content in the browser using a built-in renderer. Handy for AR no doubt. Older developers amongst us might be getting flash backs toÂ VRML..!
  • Here's the first public working draft of the CSS Nesting Module.
  • Google has changed how it displays title tags in search results, here's what you need to know.
  • Frontity, the React framework for WordPress has joined Automattic. Here's Matt Mullenweg's post on the news.
  • Google will reportedly pay Apple $15 billion to remain the default Safari search engine for another year.

ğŸ“™ Tutorials, Articles & Opinion

Building a Responsive Stepper Component â€” Runs through creating a horizontal and vertical stepper component with CSSÂ flexbox. This is fabulously detailed andÂ educational.Â ğŸ‘

Ahmad Shadeed

Pushing Back Against Privacy Infringement on the Web â€” â€œThe Web is still wrestling with issues we take for granted offline, privacy chief among themâ€. This article outlines the steps taken at The New York Times to protect user data, and how you can doÂ similar.

Robin Berjon

Accessibility from the Ground Up â€” Some sound pointers for getting started withÂ accessibility.

Kitty Giraudel

Why Use a Time Series Platform for Application PerformanceÂ Monitoring

InfluxData sponsor

Chris Coyier

On The â€¹dlâ€º â€” A look at the often forgotten <dl> element, highlighting its versatility and how to best make use of it.

items.title: A 'catty' look at the AVIF image format
items.content:
Unsubscribe

Frontend Focus

#â€‹505 â€” August 25, 2021 | Read on the web

Decoding AVIF: A Deep Dive with Cats and Imgproxy â€” Itâ€™s been nearly a year since we shared Jake Arbibaldâ€™s piece on the â€˜arrival of AVIFâ€™. Now, browser support is not quite there just yet, so this article shows us how to actually implement this modern image format today using imgproxy. We also get an excellent explainer on AVIFs benefits â€”Â all told with cute cat exampleÂ images.

Polina Gurtovaya and Andy Barnov

Why WebKit Supports AVIF But Safari Does Not
Jon Henshaw

You Can Write Your Own Angular Data Grid, butÂ Why? â€” Data grids are a daunting task. We work hard to make the task not only easy and enjoyable. Kendo UI for Angular's data grid is fast, full-featured, & customizable. And part of a 100+ component library. Learn more with component info, blogs, &Â demos.

Progress Kendo UI for Angular sponsor

canistilluseâ€‹.â€‹com â€” When looking up a certain feature on caniuse.com Jim asserts that â€œthereâ€™s an incredible assumption many of us make when interpreting its UIâ€ â€” that given enough time everything will go green and stay that way. What happens when Web functionality goesÂ away?

Jim Nielsen

HTTP/3: Performance Improvements â€” This is part two of Robinâ€™s deep-dive into QUIC and HTTP/3. This time itâ€™s a close look at the performance improvements of HTTP/3, congestion control, head-of-line-blocking, and more. Part one looked at the broader concepts of the HTTP/3Â protocol.

Robin Marx

âš¡ï¸ Quick bits:

  • Bootstrap is ğŸ‚ ten years old.
  • Microsoft and Google have collaborated to bring support for CSS module scripts to Chromium, so you can import stylesheets like JavaScript modules.
  • Here are the release notes for Safari Technology Preview 130.
  • There are neat new dev tools in Chrome Canary for easily changing unit values â€”Â as this quick Twitter video demonstrates.
  • An update from the Edge team on the upcoming rewrite of CSS Grid, and what to expect as a result in Edge and Chrome.

  • Open UI: Solving a Multi-Decade Problem (August 31) â€” An online meetup hosted by Melanie Richards & Greg Whitworth discussing the OpenUI project.
  • How To Find, Fix, And Prevent Accessibility Issues (September 14-15) â€” A free two-day online workshop packed with tips and tools for how to build more accessible sites and why itâ€™s so important.
  • CityJS/HalfStack at the Beach (September 14 - 17) â€” Takes place at an outdoor beach bar in central London, speakers include Chris Heilmann, Jo Franchetti, and others.
  • Web Directions: Code (September 17 & 24) â€”Â A remote conference for front end engineers working with PWAs.

ğŸ“™ Tutorials, Articles & Opinion

Key Data Structures and Their Roles in RenderingNG â€” Explains the components of the RenderingNG architecture (frame trees, display lists, etc), and how the rendering pipeline flows throughÂ them.

Chrome Developers

Native Search vs. Jetpack Instant Search in Headless WordPress withÂ Gatsby â€” A look at how to implement search on a Gatsby site connected to headless Wordpress. The first option uses the built-in Wordpress search via the API. The second works to improve search using Jetpack InstantÂ Search.

Paulina Hetman

Performance in Progress â€” Hereâ€™s an overview of the performance improvements the Firefox team have been implementing over the past six months, including changes to responsiveness, security, and webÂ standards.

Kim Moir

Why Use a Time Series Platform for Application PerformanceÂ Monitoring

InfluxData sponsor

Static vs. Dynamic vs. Jamstack: Where's the Line? â€” A useful attempt to define the distinction between what's just a static site, what's a Jamstack site, and what's dynamic. [â†’ Via our Jamstack newsletter.]

Mike Neumegen

Accessibility of the <Section> Element â€” Advice/thoughts on using the <section> element in a semantically appropriateÂ way.

Scott O'Hara

Creating an Interactive Gantt Chart Component with Vanilla JS â€” Coding a Gantt chart (commonly used as a way to visualize schedules) as a reusable Web component, covering the architecture of the component, rendering the calendar with CSS Grid, and managing the state of the draggable tasks with proxyÂ objects.

Anna Prenzel

The Big Gotcha with CSS Custom Properties â€” Something to be awareÂ of.

Chris Coyier

Does Shadow DOM Improve Style Performance?
Nolan Lawson

How to Build a Portfolio Site with Next.js and Tailwind CSS
Manu Arora

Six CSS Shorthand Properties to Improve Your Web Application
Carmine Scarpitta

Jobs

Frontend Developer at X-Team (Remote) â€” Join the most energizing community for developers and work on long-term projects for Riot Games, FOX, Sony, Coinbase, andÂ more.
X-Team

Frontend Engineer React.js - Cloud App (Remote) â€” We aim to provide the best developer experience for load & performance testing. Join our fully remote Frontend team of 4, while k6 isÂ growing.
K6 - A Grafana Labs Company

Hired

wavesurfer.js: Navigable Waveforms with Web Audio and Canvas â€” If youâ€™re creating a podcast player, audio experience, or anything where seeing an interactive audio waveform could be useful, check thisÂ out. Peaks.js from the BBC is also worth exploring in thisÂ area.

katspaugh and contributors

Notistack: A Library for Easy Snackbar/Toast Notifications â€” You can try out a whole slew of demos and an API reference on the docsÂ site.

Hossein Dehnokhalaji

Exclusive: Get Retool Free for Up to a Year and $160,000 in Startup Discounts â€” Retool for Startups bundles access to tools such as Retool, AWS, MongoDB, Brex, and moreâ€”so startups can build great internal tools, forÂ free.

Retool For Startups sponsor

TailwindCSS Buttons: A Unique Collection of Copy & Paste Tailwind Buttons â€” Lots of attractive and different options for buttons here and if thatâ€™s not enough, hereâ€™s another set of CSS-only buttons gleaned from various open sourceÂ projects.

Tony Lea

v-lazy-image: A Vue.js Component to Lazy Load Images â€” Uses Intersection Observer and then progressive rendering with CSS animations to keep things smooth. CodeSandboxÂ demo.

Alex Jover

'how i experience web today' â€” A frustrating and wholly accurate recreation of just trying to read an article on the modernÂ web. We can do better.
